alert.note: Alert for Kent; Queen Anne's (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 11:09PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Talbot, Queen Anne`s, northern Caroline and western Kent Counties through MIDNIGHT EDT... At 1108 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Chester, or 10 miles east of Severn River, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Easton, Centerville, Chestertown, Centreville, Oakland, Ridgely, Rock Hall, Church Hill, Sudlersville, Queen Anne, Old Town, Grasonville, Starr, Copperville, Jumptown, Newtown, Morgnec, Stevensville, Skipton and Langford. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
